text.content: WHAT'S ON TIKTOK?
Juan loves watching TikTok videos on his mom’s old phone, even if the screen is cracked.
He laughs out loud when he sees videos of little dogs dancing to reggaeton beats.
His sister Maria is more creative; she records silly skits about life in their neighborhood, often using their pet chicken as a star.
Their absolute favorite creator is Carlos, a local teen who makes raps about street life in Bogotá.
Even though their mom complains and tells them to stop wasting time, Juan secretly dreams of becoming famous like Carlos one day.
MAKING A LUNCHBOX FOR SCHOOL
Every morning, Luisa carefully packs her lunchbox with a scoop of white rice, soft beans, and a warm arepa that her mom makes before leaving for work.
Her family doesn’t have much money, so she uses a washed-out container from an old margarine tub.
Her little brother, always hungry, sometimes sneaks into her bag and takes her only banana, making her cry in frustration.
At school, her best friend Sofia notices and gives Luisa half of her sandwich without hesitation.
Grateful, Luisa promises to help her mom cook dinner that night as a way to pay forward the kindness.
NO PAYING ATTENTION IN CLASS
Diego can’t concentrate in math class because his eyes keep drifting toward the window, where he imagines playing soccer in the dusty street after school.
His teacher notices and calls out, “Focus, Diego!”
But at that moment, his phone buzzes with a message from Valentina, the crush he’s too nervous to talk to in person.
Caught in his daydreams, Diego doesn’t hear the instructions and completely fails the quiz.
As punishment, he gets detention and has to stay late, which means missing the game he was so excited about.
ANA LOST HER SCHOOL ALLOWANCE: 5 THOUSAND PESOS
Ana rummages through her messy backpack, panic rising in her chest—the small allowance her mom gave her is missing.
She had planned to buy notebooks and a quick snack before heading home.
Her loyal friend Camila suggests they go back to the bus they took earlier to retrace her steps.
The driver just shrugs and says, “No one turns in money here, niña.”
Feeling defeated, Ana walks home and cries.
Her mom isn’t angry but tells her, “Next time, hide it better.”
Until next week, Ana will have to borrow supplies from classmates to get by.
ETHICS: USING AI TO CHEAT ON MY HOMEWORK
Miguel was desperate the night before his ethics class, so he copied an essay from an online AI tool instead of writing his own.
The next day, his teacher praises his ideas, but his best friend Lucia doesn’t look happy.
“That’s cheating,” she says. “You didn’t really learn anything.”
Miguel tries to defend himself, saying that everyone uses technology now, but later that night he feels guilty.
He stays up late and rewrites the assignment in his own words.
His grade drops a little, but his conscience feels clean for the first time in days.
DEALING WITH SCHOOL DEMANDS
David struggles to balance his college applications, part-time job at the bakery, and his upcoming exams.
Last night, he stayed up late studying, so he was late to work and got yelled at by his boss.
At home, his parents are too busy worrying about bills to offer much help.
Things hit a breaking point when his old computer crashes just hours before an important deadline.
Overwhelmed by stress, David finally goes to see the school counselor, who teaches him time_management strategies.
He learns to plan breaks and prioritizes what matters.
Life is still hard, but at least now he feels more organized.
